We stood there for a few minutes before a server acknowledged us and yelled to a girl standing by the pizza oven chatting to the cook. That's when I realized she was suppose to be the hostess, but she obviously thought talking to the cook was more important. Moments before, a large group had entered the restaurant and stood behind us, and the hostess ignored me and my friend and immediately spoke to the guy behind me and asked if they had a reservation. Perhaps she thought we were all one party, but I thought that was pretty rude of her not to ask.   When we were finally seated, we were unable to get menus right away because they had run out. How do you run out of menus on a Monday night when it's not busy? I'm sure the Office Depot down the street can make color copies at $0.25 each...  Aside from that, our pizzas were pretty good. I'm not a big fan of pizzas, but I love the crispiness of the crust and how you can taste the freshness of the ingredients. I had the Vico, which was basically a white pizza with no tomatoes, and it was surprisingly very filling despite it being a very thin-crust pizza.  Long story short - good food, subpar service.

Cool decor, the service wasn't really good for start we order just water and soda but my friend ordered a beer in a wine glass (she is very picky) our server said there was a problem with the beer and he will get as soon as possible. About 10 minutes later we forgot who our server was. Finally the beer came but not in a bear glass not a wine glass. The food made up for that though it was really fresh and tasty.
Ate here on Sunday after browsing around Valley Cheese & Wine. I really like this place and I can't wait to go back to have another margherita pizza...except next time i'll ask for extra basil.

One of our favorite restaurants!  We love the Caprese Salad, the fresh tomatoes and mozzarella are wonderful to start the meal with.  I love the Diavola (spicy and so tasty), Capricciosa (savory with the veggies) pizzas, and the Misto (shaved meats, cheeses, olives, marinated zucchini and focaccia), could only be improved would be to added a few grapes and some sliced tart apple.  Husband's favorites are the Settebello and the Margherita w/ Calabrese and mushrooms pizzas.  It can be a bit busy and crowded but the staff tries to keep everything moving along as quick as they can.  Its not really a restaurant for kids but people seem to want to bring them here anyway. :-S

Nice people, knowledgable bar tender and a good selection of Italian beers beyond the usual Peroni and Moretti. The Insalata Grande someone else on here raved about was really good. I also ordered a Settebello pizza for take-out. The pizza was good, though I would have prefered it to have been cooked a bit more. By the time I got it back to my house, the crust was soggy which distracted from the overall appeal. Overall a restaurant worth visiting.

1/2/16 This is now one  of my top three favorite pizza places.   Pear and Jalapeño pizza is my new favorite pizza.   Our friends thought it might be too hot for me,  but it was the perfect amount of heat from the Jalapeño.   The crust was thin and perfectly seasoned,  I could eat the crust by itself.   We also ordered the settebello pizza,  but I preferred the pear & jalapeño pizza.

Went this week with a friend who visited the Salt Lake City location and fell in love with the pizza.  Really surprised myself with the fact that a place that sells 95% pizza and not much else besides salads that I found another good lunch location.  Okay, I'll have a salad with that pizza.  Really good as I did not expect it to overwhelm my taste buds.  But it did!  I think it was the freshly shave parm cheese.  And then came the pizza which was extremely tasty.  I had the marguarita with sausage.   Good atmosphere but a little pricey for a pizza.  Will probably return but need to be in a good mood to want to spend for a fancy, trendy pizza style.

Was very disappointing in this place. I ordered one of the white pizzas and it was flavorless. The risotto balls and salad were just ok. Service was extremely slow. My waitress took my glass of water to fill and never returned it. I noticed other customers coming in, and then leaving because they were never attended to.

This is the  second time my boyfriend and I have been here and needless to say they have not disappointed. Their food is amazing and they're always so kind. Tonight we took our friend from out of town here and, again, they did not disappoint. However, their Internet was down which meant they could not accept credit cards. After waiting a bit while (the manager?) was on the phone with their company trying to get it back up, the man came over to us and handed us a new bill, apologized for the inconvenience, and told us to have a good night. Confused, I looked at the bill and they completely compt our meal. I absolutely appreciate the gesture and working at a high end nail salon I understand when frustrations happen to where you comp a service.. I've been on that side and I understand the personal feeling of being upset that a customer would be annoyed with you for something out if your control. Needless to say, we absolutely love this place, will always pay for our meals even if they show their kindness in paying for the meal themselves, and will be a long time customer. You guys, as I've said, do not disappoint. Thank you so much for always a great experience.

Tried Settebello for the first time last night. Here's my disclaimer... I do enjoy bland foods. We ordered both the Insalata Grande and the Beet Salad.  Overall I enjoyed the beet salad more due to the dressing and the wonderful flavors. I found the Insalata Grande bland and boring. I loved the portion sizes as they were quite large, enough for two to share one salad.   I liked the fact that they offer several pizzas without a tomato base. The pizzas are 12 inches round and enough to fill up two people with a decent appetite We ordered the Vena pizza which we enjoyed. We added the arugula from the salads on top of the pizza which made it more flavorful.  I would like to return in the near future and try some of their other pizzas!
Place is amazing !! Great food ! Great wine !  Great decor ! Definitely recommend the Cesar salad and house red wine !

Amazing Napolitano style pizza. The ingredients and flavors are top notch. I have been a customer for years and I always come back for more. The only minus are the poorer dessert options compared to few years ago and the unavailability of craft beers. Food 44 Service 22 Decor 15 Total 81/100

We tried this restaurant given the high reviews and were disappointed.  Both my wife and I ordered the Settebello.  She substituted the Buffalo mozzarella and I added anchovies.  The food came out quickly (too quickly).  On the good side, the toppings were extremely good although the pancetta was undercooked.  On the bad side, the crust had little flavor, was over charred on the bottom and severely gummy in the center.  The waiter told us that this was standard for Neapolitan pizza, but I've had food in many Neapolitan restaurants and this is just not true.  The oven obviously was too hot and the pizza needed to cook more slowly.  They also need a more flavorful recipe for the dough.  In addition, we asked for parmesan cheese and what came out was the terrible Kraft type parmesan that had little flavor.  It doesn't cost that much to get real parmesan cheese and grate it at the table or right before.  Add to that, the diet coke I had did not have adequate carbonation.  The place was clean and the tables were nice but there is virtually no sound deadening and it is very noisy. The waiter was very nice, however, but you come to a restaurant for the food.  Perhaps we just got a bad meal, but we won't be going back very soon.

This place is good, don't get me wrong. I love this Italian style pizza, the service was good, and i enjoyed my meal. The thing is, if you go a few blocks over to eastern there is Grimaldi's pizza, which is that same Italian style pizza, but its just much better. The pizza was a bit cold and soft, so maybe mine was just undercooked, i dont know. Also the flavors were a little bland. So try this and you wont be too disapointed, but missing out on Grimaldi's would be the crime when its so close.

Would have to say this is my favorite pizza place, forget any of the chain pizza places, setebellos is the place to go. I enjoy going to setebellos on the days I crave pizza. My favorite pizza to get is the bolognese pizza. No specific reason except that it matches my taste buds really well. While it can get crowded every now and again I still enjoy it every time as the pizza is always worth it!

This is definitely the best pizza in the district and possibly in Vegas. My State Farm Agency is right across the street so I regularly visit them for lunch with my office staff. Great staff, great food, great atmosphere.

Margherita Napoleon was perfect! Get the buffalo mozzarella instead of regular mozzarella, worth the extra few dollars. The atmosphere was good and so was the staff. Big TV in the bar area and a good spot to grab a bite of you as traveling for work as I was.   Don't forget the affogato dessert with hazelnut gelato...
Amazing pizza and an absolutely stellar drink selection. Beautifully crafted and unique.

One of the best pizzas in Vegas. Just like the Italian one. Very friendly and nice staff. Very good happy hour and every Monday you can eat a regular Margherita for just 5$! And try Zeppole with Nutella as dessert! To die for!!!

Best neapolitan pizza in the  country.If you like real italian pizza baked in an oven from italy which runs at around 900 Degrees F.this is the place. If you like american pizza with 10 toppings DO NOT COME HERE,this place has super thin pizza.Only get 1-2 toppings,you dont need more. BTW great tiramisu.

Excellent. I had the Margherita pizza and added arugula and caramelized onions.  I couldn't detect any basil on my pizza, but other than that it was fabulous.  Perfect crust - chewy & well-toasted. The salads are amazing - can't beat the prices and they don't skimp on the goodies. Dessert.  For $5 you can get a Nutella pizza with fresh bananas and slivered almonds.  It's the same size as their entree pizzas - about 12".  And I think they apply the Nutella with a squeeze bottle.  It's beautiful - a grid of thin lines over the whole pizza, edge to edge.  The bananas are put on while the crust is still hot so they soften a bit but don't get mushy.  I've had Nutella dessert pizzas all over the country & this one is the best so far. You could go the the Strip and pay a LOT more for a similar meal but it won't come close the the quality & authenticity of this comfortable place.

This place is delicious!!! We have yet to have a meal that disappoints.  Try the Vico - I usually add mushrooms! My wife will usually order the pizza of the day. The panzanella salad is a must, dressed in a super tangy lemon vinaigrette. All ingredients are fresh and top of the line. This place is a must try.

We have been to Settebello on multiple occasions.  The first of which was a great overall experience except for the rude hostess, who was to busy gossiping to greet or bid is farewell. I had written the place off but my girlfriend convinced me to try it again and we have been back many times. So find a new hostess Settebello!!  Anyway this evening our server was Matt, who was fantastic! He have is the best service we have had there this far. We started with two salads, the caprese and the Pere de prosciutto salad. All the salads have been incredible there! The panzanella and caprese are my favorites. We also had there special pizza of the week, which had walnuts, bacon, maple vinaigrette and pears. It was the perfect combination of sweet and salty! It was the best pizza I have ever had!   I'm glad I have settebello another try, I am a huge fan!
Vreat food and service.  Moderate price but well worth it.  Margarita pizza is my favorite.

I have not had pizza like this since my trips to Bermuda. Bermuda has all these little mom and pop trattorias with amazing old world Italian. I was quickly addicted to their fresh Napoletana pizza. Settebello has awakened that addiction in me with their amazing pizza.  I started with a bottle of Italian beer, which was great. Settebello has a great selection of Italian micro brews. For pizza I went with the Settebello, because in my opinion if a dish is named after the restaurant's namesake it has to be good. Well my theory proved correct still. The Settebello didn't let me down. The ingredients were fresh and the pizza crust was perfect.  I will be feeding my addiction again soon.
Pizza with a twist......and a full bar! Mauriccio from Italia has has the perfect hand for making these pizzas. And the fresh squeezed oj mimosas.....on point

Pizza was tasty but soupy. It had a great amount of flavor but sort of just slipped off the dough. The salads might have been better than the pizza overall. Both of the salad I add (Caprese, Rucola) were both light and delicous. The atmosphere was nice and the service was friendly and attentive. It was good quality but was expecting more from so many 5 star reviews.
My wife and i had the pizza mela e asiago. The foods amazing and service is quick and friendly. We love this place!

My husband and I drove 22 miles across town to check this place out, after reading all the glowing reviews here on Yelp.  We started with the misto appetizer, which consists of slices of very fresh and excellent Italian coldcuts (salami, proscuitto, mortadella) , cheese, olives, mushrooms and foccacia bread.   It was really good.  Next, husband ordered the capricciosa and I ordered the settebello pizza.  We've been to Napoli so we knew what a Napoletana pizza should taste like (and this is what Settebello promises to deliver).  The pizza here was very good - correct thin flexible crust with a few blackened spots, foldable as it should be.  The toppings were much better than at the majority of pizzarias here in town (especially flavorful was the sausage on my pie).  But did this blow us away?  Sadly not.    That's why I'm giving it only four stars.  However, we ended the meal with the tiramisu, and that was one of the best  I have ever had anywhere!   Another point in their favor were the prices - the most expensive pizza was only $13.50.   In sum, it was a close and very good try, and we would go back again.  But we're still waiting for that blow your socks off pizza moment here in Vegas.

Real Italian pizza (Naples style. Other places in Italy make it thinner and more crusty).   The quality of ingredients is unbelievable (the prosciutto is so sweet, Parma style, the tasty mozzarella, the fresh tomatoes). They size of the pizza could be bigger.  The service? Great! Same as food. Mariana was so nice and kind. She made our evening so comfortable and enjoyable. We really appreciated her.   The price is ok considering the quality.

Great lunch or dinner spot, they mastered pizza satisfaction. This place caters to those who can distinguish between the cookie-cutter pizza places and those who want freshly baked, handmade, and quality ingredients type of pizza ...that makes you close your eyes with each bite and think you're in Italy.

I've eaten at other locations and fell in love with their food. I wanted to get together with some coworkers for happy hour but their bar is tiny so we wanted to sit in the restaurant.  When I called to give them a heads up that I wanted to bring a group of 15-20 the manager wanted to charge a 750 dollar minimum. We just wanted to get some pizza and wine. They said if we didn't hit the minimum I would be responsible for the remaining balance! It was a Wednesday and they weren't busy. Needless to say we went somewhere else! Ridiculous!

This place is simply amazing!  My (Italian) family- ranging from 3 years old to 63- and I have been probably 5-6 times in about 6 months and we have never once been disappointed.  The pizzas are authentic, fresh, and interesting.  The salads are so delicious too.  They have awesome app/drink specials weekly and their "Pizza of the Month" never fails to disappoint.  Their wine, cocktail, and beer menu is varied as well.  What else can I say?  Friendly and knowledgeable service in addition- if you are unsure what to order I'd recommend asking the wait staff for suggestions.  My perfect zonal suggestions- Panzanella Salad or Caprese, the Misto App Platter, and the Pizza Brisket, or Margherita DC Pizza, plus gelato for dessert!!

Meh...it was okay. Nothing bad on their part...their style of pizza is just not my cup of tea. I prefer a thicker crust. Not bad. Just not the best pizza I've had in my life...I likely will not be going out of my way for a follow-up visit but if a group of friends wanted to visit again, I wouldn't be opposed.
UNBELIVEABLE pizza for Vegas!!  As a New Yorker and pizza/sandwich snob, I have yet to find better pizza in Clark Co.  MUST BUST

Okay saw this place on the food network and have been wanting to stop by every time we are in Vegas but never got around to it.  Well no it we are going to try and make it a regular stop every time. The location we went to was next to Green Valley Casino its across the street in a little strip mall type area.  It is very casual dress and the place is not very big but comfortable.  There is a bar area with T.V. in the corner of the place. The PIE...I have to say that the foundation is the bread crust.  It is so doughy and just a little salty but very chewy.  Greatest tasting crust I have had since having pizza in Italy.  We just the Margherita with buffalo mozzarella it was phenomenal.  We wanted to get meat on the pizza but being our first time we just wanted to taste it with nothing but sauce and cheese, the true tell of a good pizza.  Nothing to cloud the simplicity of great ingredients. We had the pear salad with arugula and balsamic glaze and marmalade.  It was also very tasty, peppery and sweet.  It all blended together very nicely. My recommendation would be to order two pizza cause one isn't gonna be enough.  When you finish the first one your gonna wish you ordered a second.  I would have to say the service was okay.  The water we had wasn't very ....hmmmm...helpful.  I mean he took our order and brought everything we asked for don't get me wrong.  It's just we told him it was our first time there and if he had any suggestions and his response was everyone orders the "insalata grande" which is basically a large salad.  I mean with all the salads on the menu that was his recommendation.  It wasn't like he had to be excited about his job, but at least try to sell us on something.  He could have been a little more descriptive or enthusiastic about the food but it was more a hey I'm your waiter let me know what you want.  But he was polite just know you may have to wing it on your first time.  Maybe it was his off night or his first night we just wish he was a little more helpful in recommending something.
I came here solely due to the reviews. I wasn't disappointed! The pizza was amazing, great service, friendly staff and the food came out quickly. Only critique is that it's a little noisy.

Pros:  Ingredients were fresh and delish.  Service is great.  Nutella pie was wonderful.  Cons: A bit pricey averaging $14 a pie. Crust is very very very thin, if you don't consume you're pie right away...it gets soggy.  I guess I'm too loyal to Grimaldi's Pizzaria.  Restaurant is a bit small.

This is the best pizza in Las Vegas. The Diavola pizza I believe is my favorite of all time. The Margherita DOC is also delicious with the creamy buffalo mozarella. I have to have it at least once a week. The Panzanella salad goes good on top of the pizza. I was never a fan of fennel until the I tried the salad. The service is great. The food rivals Napoli's best pizza. If you're looking for authentic Neapolitan pizza you have to try this. Writing this review is making me hungry!

It was a little tough to find but that was iPhone GPS' problem not Settebello. Started with MIsto of meats, cheeses, olives, mushrooms, and artichokes - authentic and fantastic. I got the Pizza Quattro Staggione - 1/4 wood fired sausage, 1/4 olives, 1/4 salami, and 1/4 mushroom with added anchovy. Their Neapolitan style pizza is very very good with a nice thin crunchy crust - what's even better is the REAL grated Parmesan in a shaker along with your pizza. I would swear they had just grated it - it definitely was not Kraft.

If you want to go to Italy without flying, here you go!   They even import the flour and are certified by the highly selective Nepolese pizza authority.   This is real. This is not an American pizza. You want Dominos, probably not your place!  Love it!  Try the ice cream too! Cinnamon, yum!

We've been enjoying the fine Napoletana pizza here since moving to Henderson. OMG - taste exactly like the pizza you enjoy in Naples Italy. Great salads and beets salads as well. Natalia is the perfect mgr rocking a great vibe & attitude. See you again very soon. Ciao!

While I was out and about running errands. Hunger struck and only one thing sounded good... Pizza! Not just any pizza, I wanted a Margherita pizza like those I enjoyed in Italy. Settebello has long been on my list of places to try. It was finally time to give it a whirl.   When visiting the District, I go west on autopilot. Well, I had to turn around because Settebello is on the east side of Green Valley Parkway. I parked and popped in for lunch.    I was quickly seated and I knew just what I wanted, The Margherita DOC ($13.50) with Crushed Tomatoes, Fresh Buffalo Mozzarella, Basil, Parmigiano Reggiano, and Extra Virgin Olive Oil. Settebello serves up Pizza Napoletana and it is authentic. This style of pizza is cooked quickly and typically eaten with a fork and knife, but they will cut it into slices upon request. Settebello's Margherita DOC is pretty darn similar to what I had in Naples. They import ingredients and the quality is noted. However, it's worth mentioning Naples wasn't my favorite pizza in Italy, it's a bit wet for my liking, but still enjoyable when in the mood. My craving was satisfied and the best part? I only had to travel to Green Valley to get it.
Love this place reminds me of Naples ! It is not your American pizza ( which I like too! Chicago,NY,and Boston style) but its like being back in Italy.Thank you!!!

This place is amazing!!!  I lived in Italy for a few years and I know my pizza.  If you're in Vegas and you want pizza that is exactly like pizza you get in Italy, then you have to go here.  They have been allowed by the EU's business licensing as Pizza Vera Napoletana, which you need to use all of the ingredients and true pizza tastes straight from Naples.  I started with the 'Insalata Grande' and then I had the Carbonara and I couldn't have been more happy.  Best meal I've had in a year, easily, and it didn't cost me an arm and a leg (like I spent the night before at Ago's at the Hard Rock).  The young American man, form Utah, that started this place has done an amazing job.  Every little detail, from the glasses to the way the utensils are wrapped in a napkin and paper ring, make you feel like you just walked into an Osteria in Naples or Rome.  Give this place your business if you're in Vegas, and you will walk away saving some cash to gamble with and a fulfilled appetite!!!

I've been coming here since they had the first location on Horizon Ridge and the quality has not changed a bit!   If you're looking for authentic fresh Italian pizza, this is the place to go.   I usually order the Panzanella Salad to start and finish with a margarita pizza topped with spicy sausage. AMAZING.   Best part is, the crust is super thin so you can easily devour a whole one to yourself. and trust me, you're not going to want to share
Excellent pizza. The best. Had antipasto.  Was great. Prices somewhat ok. But service sucks. Needs new management to control the staff.  Very disappointed on staff but pizza greattt

We were there last night for dinner....hadn't been in awhile.  We both forgot how good the food is here!  Great classic cocktails....particularly the Manhattan and Moscow Mule.  We had an incredible salad and the Settebello Pizza.....really excellent....nice place. Service is also very nice.
obsessed!!! this place has been the most legit pizza ive been able to find since visiting italy.  i love EVERYTHING about this place and its authenticity!

I love this place because it's the closest to real Italian pizza from Italy not NY! The arugula salad is really good too and so so the tiramisu. This is basically the only place I  will order pizza to go from now on.

Settebello is one of those places you think it could be all "hype" but you can't ignore forever I'm the last guy who likes gourmet pizza but this place knows what's up  All the pizzas are awesome just order any of them  Must try if you live in Henderson   Takeout is a good plan  Or make sure you get a reso One pizza per person

The pizza is SO tasty!! The dough is almost like an Indian naan. We ordered the Settebello for the namesake. Good taste with the sausage and mushrooms and fresh tomato sauce. The pine nuts add a little crunch which you don't come across too often on pizzas but is a great addition.  We also had the Diavolo which is also nice! The peppered salami is under the cheese and has a small kick that surprises you when you bite into it a piece of pizza. The fresh basil and peppers are a lovely addition.  We still prefer the Settebello pizza. The restaurant gets 4 stars only because it teeters between being too pretentious and not and when we visit we don't know which side we will walk into.

VPN certified .. basically signed off by the Neapolitan Council in Italy ..means their pizzas are legit. I don't know what it is about the dough but my wife who doesn't really care for pizza was wowed, quite an accomplishment. I suggest initially ordering the margherita DOC. For dessert they do a great tiramisu (very light).

Happy Hour is one of those elusive things here in Vegas. There aren't many really good happy hour places, but Settebello delivers. On the happy hour, not their pizzas. You have to pick those up.  The plates are great for early snacking, very reasonably priced and quick to come out. The drinks are even on discount. Very few things are better than sipping a sangria and eating their delicious food while enjoying the 100 degree temperatures in the shade on their patio.  Service was good, attentive and prompt. Food was excellent and quick to arrive. Dessert was decadent (Sweet Cream Gelato in Espresso, a perfect finish).  I'm eagerly awaiting an excuse to head back, except next time get a pizza.

Never cared much for pizza until a foodie friend recommended Settebello.  And, now...I suffer from Settebellotitis.  I ache, crave and long for their pizza and carpaccio salad.  The freshness of the ingredients and the special preparation I know that goes into their product is undeniable.    I spent $30 for an iced tea, pizza, carpaccio salad and tip and for the average working girl, it's definitely a treat and DAMN WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!  For those who "don't get it" and think there's too much hype surrounding Settebello...well, they're probably used to the fast food junk out there and there's no reasoning with them.

Ever read The Emperor's New Clothes? Enjoy the subtleties of the story at Settebello.   Here's the gist:    excellent pizza dough cooked for 2 minutes in a 1000 degree oven. Down vote for all of the burnt spots all over the visible top crust and the bottom. Five star voters must have dead taste buds or are susceptible to group think.   crushed tomato without seasoning.  One or two pieces of basil on top. Wait a minute...  was the chef naked?  about five pieces of sausage, one tiny sliver of prosciutto, and about 1/2 ounce of mushrooms on top.   I know that pizza is a high markup commodity, but 75 cents of ingredients for a $13 pizza is outrageous. Don't look at me smugly and tell me that scant ingredients let the flavors reveal themselves.  The burnt spots on the pizza completely smother all the flavors.

The dough (crust) comes out burned/charred. I am OK with the tasteless tomato sauce some people mention, I actually like sauce like that. Some other pizzerias just add too many spices in the sauce and I don't like it.  But why, or why? Why do you burn the crust like that. Please, don't tell me that's how oven baked or wood fired pizza should be. I've tried them all and the crust should NOT be so burned. Check out my photos. It was so bad, my kids did not want to eat the pizza, in the end they ate only the mid secrion of it.   The pizza is very thin. The sauce and cheese are light. Toppings tasted good. These are all food things. That's why I give it 2 stars.  Other bad things - other parts of the pizza were slightly burned as well and the toppings were unevenly spread.  Please, fix your ovens or replace them.

Such great pizza, I wish it weren't so far from my home.  However, I have schlepped over there three times now and have tried the Diavola, Bianca and Pizza Lasagna (still a pizza, but with ricotta mixed into the toppings).  I would be hard pressed to pick a favorite and will probably keep working my way through their menu.  The pizzas are large enough that I can't always finish one, but not so big I only want half.  They use quality ingredients and the crust is the perfect blend of crusty exterior and chewy, flavorful interior. Last time I was there, it wasn't busy but service was not good.  However, I can overlook that when the food is this amazing.
My favorite Pizza place in town. Great food and drinks! The pizza is spot on Naples, Italy style.  Amazing!
This place actually just moved and is worth the trip: http://www.yelp.com/biz/settebello-pizzeria-napoletana-henderson-3

I love the Happy Hour menu but the service just continues to get worse and worse. Their reverse happy hour is from 8-9 pm, and on the last two times I've gone, I arrived with some friends at 8:25. The server Tricia literally greeted the table by saying "You know you have 10 minutes to order right?". How about Good evening! Welcome to Settebello! Can I get some drinks started for you? Lol. Didn't check on us once and we had to ask the busser to order another round of drinks. I get you want to leave, but it's just plain rude. There's plenty of good happy hours in the area with great food AND service, don't go where they obviously don't want the business.

Stopped in one afternoon after touring some nearby apartments. The pizza was delicious and the staff was helpful and friendly. We got a couple different pizzas and both were really nice. The prices weren't outrageous either. Great place to stop before or after a movie!

I've had pizza in Naples, Sali's pizza in New Haven, & I've had Tony's pizza in SF; this pizza is not good.  either the dough is over hydrated or the oven isn't hot enough.  The crust is soggy with absolutely no crunch or snap.  The toppings are bland and very little salt.
Very authentic italian style pizza. Equates to thin crust in the US. But the dough is so fresh, you can taste the autenticity of it. Good beers as well. Desserts are all really good.

My favorite place to go for pizza!  I always order the same thing. ..the capricciosa.  My husband likes to go here for their gluten free crust (which you can order 24 hours in advance).  The service is always good here and I always leave with a full and happy tummy!

I find this place to be absolutely yummy. I am a napoletan pizza groupie! I love it napoletan pizza! It's the only pizza! I'm obsessed. My grandmother was from Napoli and she would have approved of this place I'm sure of it. I've been to Napoli myself, and although there is NOTHING like the actual real deal, I must say, they come close...eh on a good day. I have never had a bad experience, but their service is kind of wack ya know?!       I remember the first time I went in there when it first opened. I was so excited! Finally a napoletan pizza place conveniently located! Anyway, I was asking some of the staff a few questions about some italian liquors and if they use mozzerella di buffala, and no one knew what I was talking about. So that kind of killed my excitement. All and all the food is good. I love the Margarita or that Diovala  pizza. The Capri pizza is pretty good too, and I love the Misto (meats and cheeses). I suggest eating it there. I picked it up today, and its not as good as it is freshly made. I kinda hate to say Due Forni on town center drive is better. I will stick to that place after tonight. At least there, they are well versed and appreciate the love and culture of a true 'taliano.

This is THEE best pizza I have had in all of Las Vegas! I am gluten free and this is also by far the best gluten free pizza I've ever had in my lifetime. This is our go to pizza place and it's great every single time!!!
Simply the best gluten free crust anywhere in the world! We will be back again and again. Friendly and attentive staff. You will not be disappointed if you haven't already been.

I will never eat here again. I ordered a salad and under one of my leaves was a LIVE GRASSHOPPER.  It was just chillin in there!! I'm all about keeping food natural-but what?? After I told the waiter they comp'ed the Salad but nothing else. Did I expect too much wishing for a comp'ed meal? Usually I'm not about causing a problem but I had a LIVE BUG in my food. So yes, there is no way am I coming back.

visited Settebello yesterday for a to-go lunch order.  I went with the "settebello" pizza ($13.50) - sausage, pancetta, mushrooms and pine nuts.  After ordering, walked down to Rocket Fizz to pick-up a few "artisan" sodas.  Returned just in time to pick up pizza and go my way.  I felt the pizza was undercooked - very slight charring on the top of the pizza crust,  The mozzarella was not melted, a boatload of pine nuts, yet very light on mushroom..  Still, the flavors were there - especially liked the sausage and the pancetta.  I'm hoping this is simply a " working out the kinks" situation yet I wonder since at the time I entered the restaurant, I only saw 3 customers - what happens when there are 30 customers ???  I'll return

Late night happy hour prices and selection are amazing!  We had dinner and drinks for less than $30 and it was very satisfying and fulfilling.  Pizza is woodfired and tasty.  The service was very good as well.

I went with a large group of girls (about 10-12) for happy hour prior to seeing a movie.  The happy hour is very well priced and the drinks/food are delicious. I had an Old Fashioned which was pretty good and only $5.   We ordered a few mini pizzas and an artichoke crostini.   The crostini was pretty basic and kinda tasted like artichoke from a can slapped on to some toast with goat cheese.  The mini pizzas were excellent. Perfect char on the crust from the brick oven and the sauces/cheeses were well blended.  The service however was lacking. It was apparent the first few minutes of arrival that the staff was struggling with the amount of people in the bar area...we were the bulk of the people in the bar. The waitress took all of our orders but didn't write anything down. Sadly, she had to return to confirm what was ordered but didn't want more than one person talking at a time. She then starting making drinks as well while another person was behind the bar not doing much of anything. Next time, write things down and nudge your co-worker to help you out.
We have never failed to find the pop of flavored our hungers seek in 4 years of dining at Setto Bello!!! Excellent favors artfully constructed to please the eye as well.

Customer service was great, the specialty pizza was had a good crust flavor and texture was what i expected, but the meatballs i ordered were hot on the out side, cold in the middle and very the fried risotto and sauce it came with was very bland and not propperly seasoned... so i doubt i will go back... for $50 pizza meal for two i believe pizza rock is a better choice.

I am a local and I have been on the hunt for the perfect Italian eatery.  I FOUND IT!  I was invited by an Italian family to join them for a late supper.  Surprisingly they have a $5 menu.  I ordered Artichoke Bruschetta and a small hand made pizza at $5 each.  I would have paid more!!!  Guys this is the REAL DEAL.  Real and authentic Italian food.  Wonderful vibe and awesome servers.  I will definitely be back with my family.  Thanks for a truly enjoyable dining experience.

Where do I start, the pizza... too obvious, ok ok uh,  the meat.. Ya ya the meat! The prosciutto is better than any deli I've been to or maybe it's what that 900 degree wood fire oven does to it but it's lovely on my tongue. They don't have pepperoni, what you say, a pizza joint that doesn't have pepperoni is 5 stars? Yes they have a spicy salami and after,  you'll wish your pizzeria did too! So yes the food is fantastic, but without the service no matter how good it was you wouldn't come  back. They always greet you with a smile, make sure your cup no matter what it is, is always full.

I really don't know what the hype is about. The pizza is not good and expensive. 12 inch pizza starting at $10-$11.  Very thin crust and very little toppings. Hubby ordered the diavolo and thought it was good. It was ok for me. Thin crust, soggy in the middle. I ordered the margherita pizza and asked if they had fresh spinach. Nope- no spinach. What? Ok so got it after a short wait. For those that don't know, it is plain pizza with tomato sauce, buffalo cheese, basil, garlic. There was 3 tiny pieces of basil. People- for $10 can u put at least 6 or 7 basil pieces - u are making a profit. Thin soggy crust, cheap toppings for high prices. I will say their panna cotta was good. But I would not come back here. Pappa John- here I come!!

Pizza was super tasty I got the Pizza Carbonara and man was it delicous, maybe one of the tastiest pizza's ive ever had, they had a nice selection of tasty beers that I enjoyed, restaurant looked very clean inside and well designed. I'll definitely be making a stop there next time im in the vegas area.

Great authentic pizzeria. This is the real thing, if your looking for American pizza this is not it. Traditional Italian pizza, softer crust, but fresh. Everything down to the condiments,  silverware and music are italian. Try the Mist if you love good antipasto. The Inalada Grande (salad) is awedome, and i dont like dalad much.Great atmosphere.

Was just in there, solo, to chill out, eat some pizza, drink some wine and hang out.   Random drunk dude (at 8:30pm) approaches me and asks me if I want a shot of Jack (no). Proceeds to harass me about my haircut and ask me if I know his homeless buddy who, also, is from Seattle.   Then he asks me if I have a problem with him?   Pizza to go please!  I called the bartender after I left and told him he had a problem on his hands with that guy and he seemed receptive but, honestly, he should have sniffed that problem out right away.  Shit shouldn't get that weird in a place like that. There were families in there and I'm sure they weren't looking for a guy like that around them.   Full disclosure; I like to party and I do like to drink and be inappropriate... a lot. Just not in someplace like that. Ain't nobody got time for that when there are kids around.  Pizza was OK out of a box at home. Drank a beer and jumped in the pool.

Proceed with caution, may be habit forming. If you want authentic thin crust, Neapolitan pizza that tastes like it's fresh out of Italy, then this is the place for you. This is my absolute favorite pizza place in the Las Vegas/Henderson area.  + Tasty, fresh hot pizza   + Margarita pizza is my top choice  + Insalata grande is light & a perfect starter to share + Located In The heart of Green Valley, by Wholefoods + They offer gluten-free crust + Service is always fantastic + The have a good happy hour (M-Th, 3pm - 6pm)  - They charge about $5 for gluten-free  - It's so good you will most likely overeat   Take a quick trip to "Italy" and get ready to devour some cheesy, steamy, heavenly PIZZA! If you think it sounds like it can't get much better, you're wrong it does. I've tried every single dessert, each more gratifying than the next.

Don't know what has happened to the Henderson location.  Not only has the food gone south (very bland and tasteless) but they are allow there male servers to mimic the scum that walk the streets with their pants so low that there butts hang out.  I can tolerate it when I don't have to pay and eat from the person who dresses like this.  Or maybe it is just that the management doesn't care!

Best pizza I've had outside of Florence Italy, the flavor and crust is spot on. Try the margarita, it will transport you back there...I promise (even if it's just for a few seconds ;))  We come for  the happy hours because the 2 for 1 beer prices just can't be beat. plus, I really like their italian craft brews selection (im pretty sure i've posted a picture of the ones we liked before).  The staff is usually pretty good, but we always sit at the bar...so that probably helps. though I will say (Kendra the bartender) was by far our favorite.
Really great love there pizza it's authentic the way a pizza should taste fresh .

Stopped by here for lunch with my husband 1.5 weeks ago because we saw this restaurant featured on the Cooking Channel's Unique Eats. This restaurant is different from your typical pizzeria because of their Neapolitan style pizza (slices of mozzarella on pizza instead of the shredded with toppings you desire all cooked in a wood burning oven).   When we came into this restaurant, we were immediately acknowledged and seated right away. This is what we ordered:  Settebello- This was definitely one of the better pizzas I have ever had. Our server said this was one of their most popular pizzas (he told this after we ordered it). This pizza was really good, as it had a nice crisp, thin and tender chewy crust. All of the flavors in the 1st bite was very satisfying and I would order this again. By the way, because this restaurant is trying to be as authentic as the pizzas in Italy, they do not normally serve the pizzas pre-sliced like you would find in other restaurants. But he said we could request for them to cut it for us if we wanted. We just cut a piece of the pizza to share ourselves.  Panzanella Salad- good portion, clean tasting and something I wanted because I was jonesing for salad for lunch. I asked for the salad dressing to be placed on the side and it came as I had requested. This salad isn't exactly memorable, but I got what I wanted and was satisfied with it.   Overall, our lunch was a good experience. It wasn't too crowded when we arrived (around 12 pm) but could see that they do get a good lunch crowd. The only negative thing I would say about our experience though was our server. He was rather strange because he would say some real odd comments that make you just kind of think 'what...?' .... but other than that, no other negatives.   By the way, this place is located in the same plaza as Whole Foods. There is plenty of parking and there is outdoor seating here.

This place is as good as it gets.  I used to live in chicago and while I'm a fan of the chicago-style pizza, I would throw chicago-style pizza in front of a bus to save Napoletana-style pizza's life anyday.  Can we just talk about the crust?  The chewiest, softest, goodest (yeah I know it's not a word) crust in the UNIVERSE.  I've never had a bad pizza here and I've been here probably at least 25 times.  This is my ultimate suggestion to order...no matter how many or few people you are with.  You can always take some home:  Get an apertivi to start.  Anything with Aperol in it is ok by me.  Ensalada Grande (mixed leafy greens, kalamata olives, artichoke, sauteed mushrooms, tomato and parmigiana cheese)  Misto platter--Italian meats, cheese and foccacia bread  ANY pizza or ask for the Ripieno calzone.  It's not on the menu anymore, but by far my favorite.  I like it more than their pizza.  Then pretty much any dessert.  Happy eating yo!

A fine certified pie. The crust passes the fold test though I felt it was a little bready. The sauce was top notch. Great service just before noon. The atmosphere was a fit for the area though maybe a little sterile.

I would have given it 4 or 5 stars but I'm getting tired of them changing things time and time again. We have been going there since it opened and first they stopped serving sangria Italiano. Sangria is a definite must have! Then they keep changing the Misto! It use to have a great roasted zucchini and Kalamata type olive's along with the selection of meats, then a changed to an awful green olives,  now they have a awful fried eggplant and fried zucchini. Who wants more grease with the fats from the meat? The fresh selections were a much better choice! Service has been slipping a bit also..

This is the only pizza place my husband and I like in town. They have gluten free crusts that actually taste good! ($4 extra charge, FYI.) The service is great! They personalize the pizza to our liking, and they are very nice. The pizza is yummy. The salads and beet dish are also very good. Nothing to complain about here.

Been several times. Always great!  The pizza size is a hearty meal for one, or a delicious part of a meal for two.  My date and I usually split a pizza and a salad (the Beet Salad is a fave!) and that is plenty for two big guys. If we're still hungry, we'll finish up with one of the delicious deserts.    Last night, we shared the seasonal special - the Ripieno Autunno, which was absolutely fantastic! One of my favorite things ever!  "Ripieno" just means 'stuffed' - and "Autunno" (as you might guess) is 'Autumn'.  This stuffed and folded pizza was truly special. Sweet squash combined with sausage and a generous amount of fresh sage stuffed into a perfectly baked crust made for a perfect cool-weather repast. Stuffed with Autumn, indeed!  As a bonus, we happened to be there on a Thursday - when the drink special is Margaritas of several different sorts for the extremely reasonable price of $4. I had the "Italian" Margarita - which had Amaretto and orange juice. Unusual, and I don't know if I'd call it a "margarita" - but I liked it! (I had a second).   Four drinks, the Ripieno and a very large salad came to just under $50 - which isn't cheap, but is quite reasonable for the quality of the food and the nice-casual vibe of the restaurant.

I LOVE this place. It's so yummy and the staff is great. As a college student, I studied in Italy for a semester, and let me tell you, THIS is authentic Italian pizza! Heaven. I'd eat it every day if I didn't think my derrière would get too big.

My wife liked the pizza and experience which is why we will probably return. The service staff was always friendly and kept my coke refreshed which I appreciate. Wife had a glass of their white sangria. We ordered the vegetable, cheese and meat antipasta appetizer which was good, I felt the cheese could have been better options, I did really enjoy the olives, spicy marinated zucchini and meats served with this app. For entrees my wife had the bolognese pizza (as I mention before she loved) and I had the Settebello pizza, named after the restaurant or vise versa. For having this name the pizza was underwhelming. The sausage was bland, the pine nuts didn't add to the dish, plus the pizza got soggy quickly, I prefer a crispy crust. I did enjoy the crushed pizza sauce. For dessert we ordered the mint chip gelato and panna cotta, both were very good. The restaurant was busy and in a great location within the district.
Amazing food and service but the temp in the restaurant was unbearable.  This is the second time we have been at this establishment where it seemed the air wasn't on.

Nice environment. But best pizza in Vegas? Not so much. Friendly fast service was the best part. The pizza was good, different and interesting. But for my fellow westsiders Grimaldi's is much better and closer.
I usually am not a fan of thin pizza, but Settebello is amazing.  This traditional pizzeria is always a treat for my family.

Overall this place is just plain and just OK. The atmosphere is good, the service was good, but the food is sub-par. I imagine it's fine for happy hour but otherwise I don't think the pizza and salad is good.

One of our favorite pizza places in the Henderson/ Vegas area. The atmosphere is sleek and clean while the servers are friendly and attentive. The pizza is served quickly so it's hot and fresh. If you enjoy Napoli style pizza, you need to check this place out.   If you have a taste for spicy food and meat, the Diavola is a good choice. It's made with peppered salami, garlic, roasted red peppers and crushed red pepper.  If you love arugula and prosciutto, do the Bianca. It does not have crushed tomatoes (binding sauce) but has a generous amount of shaved parmigiano reggiano.  The Involtini di prosciutto is so good. It is basically, arugula wrapped in prosciutto and topped with par-reg and goat cheese, with drizzled olive oil and balsamic reduction.  The Caprese is fresh as well.

Delicious personal sized pizzas with lightweight fresh crust. It's made in a real brick fire oven in the back, with you can tell by the crusts lightly charred edges, which i personally love. The wine and mixed drink se toon here is decent and pairs well with the food type. My date and i ordered s salad as well to split and I'm glad we didn't get two! It quite large, fresh, and tasty ! This is a yummy, reasonably priced, cute little date nite spot!

Once again, our visit was wonderful!!!Food, service, atmosphere.   Thoroughly loved our insalate grande ,margerita pizza, house chianti and expresso. p.s. I included a photo of my husband with the pizza:-)  We will return next time we are back in town.

Booked a group late for 40+ people and they were absolutely perfect with the service. No complaints at all about the requests for multiple tabs(kids sports team event) and all the food came out fast and hot. The server, without being asked, inquired about food allergies(gluten and nut) and had alternatives ready  It was my first time at a Settobello and I am excited to know there is one close to my home in Orange County. The 'style' of pizza was perfect, the dough was incredible, and the side salads and meatballs were great too. Also, a very good bar with a great selection of beers on draft and bottle.   Final observation, the build-out was modern, comfortable and clean without feeling 'stuffy'..

This place has 4.5 stars for a reason: awesome Neapolitan style pizzas.  I've been coming to this restaurant for 7 years, basically whenever I travel to Vegas I stop in, sometimes more than once per trip. If you've never had this style of pizza, and there are more and more places that are doing it, then you should definitely try it.  Settebello is one of the first places to have started making pizza like this in Vegas.    They've recently expanded the menu, offering more combinations of toppings.  I almost always go with the Margherita, which is insanely good for being just crust, sauce, mozzarella and a little basil.  A tip though: always ask for the pizza sliced (the standard is not to slice it).  The rest of the menu has expanded a bit, too, where they now offer a wider array of salads, salumi, and oven-roasted appetizers.  In my opinion, the Rucola salad is the best and unique - again, just arugula, lemon juice, olive oil, salt and pepper, and they manage to turn a set of humble ingredients into something great.
If you like super thin pizza in a brick oven with fresh great ingredients you should definitely come here .

I know this is supposedly the best pizza in Vegas, but I guess I'm not a huge fan of it...  First off, the service here is wonderful. They are all very attentive and friendly, checking to make sure everything is to your liking. The wait can be long but they'll give you water as you're waiting. There's always the option to sit at the bar too and get some appetizer before a table opens up.  The menu has a decent selection of pizzas and they usually have a special pizza of the day. You can get pizzas with or without tomato sauce. The pizzas I have tried are the Diavola, the Vico, and one of their specials of the day but I can't remember too much about it.   Diavola - It has a very nice little kick from the crushed red peppers and the salame gives a good saltiness.  Vico - The mascarpone pretty much melted and mixed with the olive oil and was a great substitute for having no crushed tomatoes. I was skeptical about no tomatoes but was pleasantly surprised. I also really liked the fennel and wood oven sausage, even though I generally am not a fan of sausage.  So why the 3 stars? I'm not a huge fan of their crust. It's a bit too wet and thin for me. This is one of those very thin pizzas where it's probably easier to eat with a fork and knife. For me, I like a crust that can hold its weight and has a nice crunch. Theirs is nice and doughy, which I do like, but it doesn't have that solid crust I really like in a pizza. Their toppings are great and all work well together, but there is very little.. I know this is supposed to be how traditional pizzas are, but I guess my poor student budget doesn't agree with it too much.    This isn't the best pizza in my eyes, but everyone has different tastes. It is undeniably good in terms of quality of toppings, but it just doesn't have the amount I would like. And that crust, it leaves me wanting more crunch!
Heard great things about this place.  It did not disappoint.  If you want a thin crust pizza that folds and places a giant smile on your face, this is it.  Great service, great value

Usually one of our favorites. Waited 1 hr.  for pizza that never came. Finally left after paying for salads. Mentioned to hostess on exiting. They were very busy but should know Friday in December always is. Very disappointed.

Pizza I ordered sucked return to waitress I ordered only meat pizza sausage Didn't notice it was white sauce and broccoli .....disgusting ....terrible , wife ordered magahrita pizza loved it so it was just mine and bad taste...... Service sucked

Simply delicious! Excellent service. Amazing pizza! We arrived in time for happy hour and I ordered a mini pizza and a salad. It was perfect. The draft beer was nice and cold. My husband loved his pizza too. They have a real wood burning oven. The dough is delicious!!! We highly recommend it.
This place has the best pizza! It reminds me of real Italian pizza. Happy Hour specials are good also!

We live a couple of miles away and go about once every couple of months...Every time the only question is why don't we go more often? This is not anything you find in the chains, it is truly one of a kind for the Las Vegas area. Don't expect anything with a stuffed crust or slogan, just an unpretentious atmosphere and great food from a menu that sticks to what they are good at. PS don't try to get it for take out, it is never as good as right from the oven.
Excellent! We had a Caprese salad & Pizza Carbonara.  Both were outstanding and reasonably priced! I'll be back!
I ordered the Carbonara pizza. It was a little soggy for my taste... Service was good, and they got the pizza to us pretty fast. I don't think I'd ever go back, but I wouldn't avoid it either.

We have been coming to settebello for a long time and the reason they are still open and busy after all these years is because the quality is consistent. We never, ever had a bad experience! I love their pizza! I am from Italy and their pizza reminds me of the flavor of pizza I used to eat in Italy. Their Tiramisu is delicious also.

When my BF and I want pizza, this is where we go. We start by sharing one of their delicious salads. We especially like the Insalada Grande, Panzanella and Romania. The greens are always very fresh and the other ingredients are top notch. And then we usually have the Settebello pizza but sometime order a Margherita or Diavola pizza. We love their thin crust and fresh ingredients. Ask for their spicy oil to really bring out the taste.

This new wave of Neapolitan pizza is very welcomed, as it is a great new edition to the NY (yum), Chicago (YUM!), and California (eh) styles that have dominated here for years. Settebello, much like the the other Neapolitan joints I have tried, concerns itself with quality ingredients, which is the most important key to a good pie, regardless of the style. On our visit, we had the Diavola and the namesake Settebello pizzas. Both were nifty little numbers. The only part that was lacking was a slightly soggy middle, which is a common side effect from the Neapolitan style of cooking. In addition to the pizza, Settebello offers a decent wine list at reasonable prices. The location is in a strip mall. And while they tried jazzing it up with some "Old World" looking touches (executed with varying degrees of commitment), it still feels like you are in a strip mall. Our service was just jake. Settebello is not the type of experience that would prompt me to drive across the valley (it is about as far from my house as anywhere in the Vegas area), but it is a superb option if I find myself in the same hood.
Probably the best place in Vegas area for italian style pizza. Prices could be a bit lower but still reasonable

OMG! Fabulous tasting pizza crust.  I mean it was truly a memorable experience eating here.  Between four of us, we had the Misto, and we tried four different pizza (ended up taking 1.5 home).  All good, with the exception of the Margherita, which was a bit on the soggy side.  I enjoyed it so much, I will go just for the Misto--A Sampling of Italian Style Meats, Vegetables and a Bite of Cheese. Served with Focaccia!!    My only reason for JUST 4 stars was the 'tiny bit soggy'  Margherita pizza.

Highly recommended, make the trip if you can! Every visit has been delicious. Pizza is simple in the best way. Staff is friendly, and even when it's busy, the atmosphere isn't overwhelming. Make sure to get your own pizza; you're gonna want to eat it all!!

Great Happy Hour and really friendly service 1st, a shout out for the bartender MADISON or was it MADISAN? She was GREAT and my wine glass was never empty, she was really helpful with my wife's food orders (my wife is a Vegan so thats not easy.) and she had no problem making suggestions (i like that) The food was all above average and tasted great from the happy hour menu The only reason I gave it a 4 and not a 5 is because they have their own label for all the wines and i can't find them on the internet, I like tracking and saving wine info with Vivino app My wrap up is: Service 100%, Food was AMAZING (I didn't like the Tiramisu that much) Wine selection, Very Good not huge, but I liked all the wines I tried (5 in all)  Im not sure if the 5th wine was good or not, my Buzz was making everything seem good by then haha  I will go back for sure

My search for good pizza continues...  When I first came across Settebello's reviews on yelp, I imagined a quaint Italian bistro, sitting in front of a wood fired oven.   We walked in, and I was disappointed at how commercial it looked. But getting to the food-the most important part, I didn't think it was worthy of 4 stars. Something about my sauce dripping off of my paper thin crust didn't appeal to me.  I've tried many different types of pizzas and this wasn't the hearty cheese+topping rich pie that I like. I shared a pizza with my fiance who shares my passion for pizza, and he agreed. We left feeling hungry.  On a brighter note, the ingredients although few were fresh.  Also, the tiramisu was delicious. Not too heavy or sweet.  Last but not least the prices were very affordable.

Love the atmosphere. Service is great. Quality of the food makes it 4 stars. If I compare it to the authentic pizza I've had in Napoli, its 50% close. Not quite there, but it's as close as I'm gonna get for now. I'll definitely come back.

First time here we started off with meatballs and then a 12in pizza that are waiter put together for us very delicious and now he's going to put us a dessert that he recommend I would recommend this establishment to anybody that likes thin crust pizza and very clean establishment we will return.

Delicious. Their ensalada grande is still on of my favorites, with mushrooms, pine nuts and artichokes. My friend and I both had a Californian Nebbiolo, which was tasty and in hindsight, we should have split a bottle, but the server didn't recommend it and we didn't think of it. Service was nice, not overbearing but attentive. I had the diavala, which was super yummy and my friend, the Bianca with prosciutto and arugula. Both were tasty, but I felt were missing something.... Something spicy, perhaps, more than just dry chili flakes.

I have heard so many good things about Settebello and I finally got to try it!  First of all, the service is amazing - from the hostess to the server to the busser. Someone was always checking to see if we needed refills or anything else. I tipped generously for that.   Second, the decor was cute and very authentic looking. I've been to Italy and Settebello blended the wood and marble aesthetic perfectly.   As far as the food goes, I wasn't super impressed with the pizza brisket I got which is why I'm not giving 5 stars; it just felt like it was missing something. Also, while the meatballs were good, there was a lot of bread in them (sometimes more bread than meat).   Overall, I would definitely come back again and try something different!
Great restaurant. Good food, good happy hour, good people (Bryan and Tyler). highly recommend

The food was full of fresh ingredients and was overall tasty. I do wish that their pizza crust would have been crisper though. I would not say that it's one of those places that will become a staple when dining out, but it does have a great atmosphere and service. The prices are mostly in the $9-$15 dollar range.

I love settebello! Austin and Matt's service was next level, they were so kind and gave the best recommendations. My hostess Lexi was very sweet as well. I really enjoy coming here & the food is great!

Food was really good but the service was horrible! The salads were very good and refreshing. The pizzas were amazing! We will return but probably to-go since the service was bad. When we arrived there were 2 other tables in his section and I thought ok maybe he's new or something but he only got worse as the tables left. We not once asked for several items so it's not like we were asking for much, just you know basic service. We ran out of drinks multiple times and we had a pile of dishes that the nice runner had to take. When he dropped check he didn't even offer dessert or say thanks. We had to get up and there were like 5-6 employees and they were all trying to get his attention to pay us out. Wow..maybe it was a rough day?

worst of the worst, flavorless, burnt pizza dough, fake wannabe pancetta, they use low bid fatty shit bacon, pizza makers unskilled, wait staff, useless, like italy no service nor concern for you the paying guest, just pure, shit quality. no flavor zero, no service zero, tables dirty and shake, mgmt even worse then staff no where to be found. just a big joke to a real business, total joke of a place that nobody, really wants to just say no no no.  give up eating if this is to be a italia ristorante a nasty dirty lazy fucking place
This place has sadly gone "American style ". The pizzas are more saucy and less Neopolitan style. It's supposed to be authentic! Not anymore. It's still really good, but not like it was! So sad!

WOW! I never knew pizza could taste sooooo good! you each order your own 12" pizza so you really get what you want...the freshest prosciutto to roasted mushrooms, fresh mozzerella, in house crushed tomotoes....this is making my mouth water just talking about it.......the hand tossed oven baked crewy hot crust!!! so delicious.   THIS IS THE ONLY PIZZA YOU SHOULD EVER EAT! and once you do, say good bye to Round Table, Papa John's, the pizza joint on the corner or where ever you are getting pizza and come to Settebello and eat like you are in Italy, Ciao~

From out of town, randomly stopped into this place and SO GLAD WE DID. The food was incredible, we ordered the brisket pizza and it did not disappoint. Our server Thomas was amazing, and on top of everything. So impressed by this spot. Will be back next time we are in town!!

A large group of us visited here for the first time and were not that impressed. The restaurant itself was nice as was the service. We ordered a number of things including three different salads, a bruschetta appetizer and three different pizzas. The salads and appetizer were solid. The pizza was a letdown. The dough was very flimsy and seemingly undercooked. The toppings were okay but the pizza itself was almost room temperature. If we ever return we will be sure to ask for the pizza to be cooked well done.

I thought I was in Naples!They serve authentic traditional neapolitan style pizza, thin crust, super fresh ingredients, just a few toppings.....delicious.....salads and appetizers are yummy too  - and the gelato is as good as it gets.  Run don't walk to Settebello!
The food is good, the prices are ok, the service was excellent. The place is cute, and has ample parking.
This is my favorite spot.  We always get the margherita pizZa and insalata.  Great texture and flavors.

We were greeted and acknowledged when we entered. The staff was attentive and asked us immediately what we would like. Table was cleaned and setup quickly and then we were greeted by the server Austin. We would definitely will be back especially since the staff was on point with the customer interaction.  We weren't blown away by the pizza though. Maybe it was the hype from friends, but don't get me wrong, it was good pizza. We ordered the Insalata, Margherita pizza, and got meatballs for an app at the recommendation of the waiter Austin. Meatballs and salad were great and ordered a kids cheese pizza for the little guy in our family who loved his pizza. Want to come back and try the Nutella dessert pizza.

Great thin crust pizza. Nicely charred a bit on bottom as it should be. You have to try the Pear and Jalapeno jam pizza. You only get it in this location and it's amazing. it sounds weird, but it's an amazing flavor combination. I also love their Pizza Capricciosa. The Romana Salad and the Beet Salad are very good too. One of the best things though, is their Panna Cotta dessert. Perfect consistency, not overly sweetened and has a nice added touch with the Strawberry and Balsamic on top. Décor is rustic and spacious with a "generous" feel to it. Service is very good as well.  We've been there many times and got served by different people but it was always great and friendly service.

I feel like the quality of food has dropped a little bit since I last ate here.  Went here for lunch yesterday and I was hugely disappointed.  Ordered the marinara pizza like I always do.  There was wayyyyyy too much sauce...to the point where the pizza dough was extremely soggy.  It just had an all around bad texture & taste... even my toddler wouldn't touch it after one bite.  I couldn't believe how terrible it was.  I also ordered the insalata grande salad and it didn't taste that great; not sure what the change was.  Not sure that I will go back anytime soon.
Great pizza and craft Italian beers.  Saw the place on Travel Channel and had to try it.

Worst experience by far ! We have been coming to settebello for years and today was a disgrace , our appetizer didn't come out until our pizza , then I found a BUG crawling in my pizza and the waiters response was "well I can assure you it didn't go in the oven that way " well you got that one right ! How was that any type of response ? It's a joke then my boyfriends parents pizza came out they are kosher and specifically asked for no meat and yet there was meat on the pizza! We  sent it  back and we waited once again . And our waitress was never to be found ever word of advice settebello train your employees and chefs the correct way to avoid disgusting mistakes and rookie mistakes as a restaurant . HUGE disappointment sad to say we will never be back .

I have been wanting to try this place out since I read an article in forbes magazine that setebello is one of the best places for pizza in the US.  We've tried a lot of Pizza places in Las Vegas Dom De Marco's was good, but when  we tried the setebello this place hands down has the best pizza in town. Thin crust with great selection on fillings. We did try their happy hour and their selection was great. We will definitely come back and try the other selections of pizza.

Tequila Mockingbird. The name of one of their drinks!!!! Check them out to see the rest of their PUNNY drink list.    We came in on a Saturday night and it was empty. (maybe they don't realize the goodness that is Settebello).   We were greeted by the host and he was very friendly; we cracked jokes with each other. We got a booth and were given time to look at the menu.  Waters came out and while we glanced at the drink menu. They had some pretty funny drink names: Tequila Mockingbird was our fave. lol We ordered our pizzas: capricciosa and diavola.   The pizzas came out pretty fast and they were made to perfection. The capricciosa had crushed tomatos, prosciutto cotto, artichokes, mushrooms, olives, mozzarella, basil and olio. The blend of these ingredients were so mouthwatering; I couldn't stop eating!! I finished the whole pizza by myself lol.  My friend had the diavola which had crushed tomatos, red bell peppers, spicy salame, garlic, mozzarella, basil and olio. I didn't get to taste it but only because my friend ate all of it--meaning it had to have been delicious since he is very much so italian (speaks it fluently, so I guess that means his opinion is legit).   The service was great as well; our waitress was attentive and friendly; she checked in with us and wasn't overbearing at constantly checking in.   I'll come back and maybe with more friends next time :) Next time I'll try the Crime and Punish-Mint cocktial!! haha

Came in to try out their happy hour. They have two times 3-6 and 830-close.   The table ordered Moscow mules ($5), arancini ($5), Diavola pizzette ($5), Vico pizzette ($5), and a Emilia pizzette ($5). This was a great way to try out the different pizzas they had to offer.   There were two arancini that came with the order. The crust was delightfully crunchy and crisp which complimented the fluffy filling and tangy marinara sauce. (4/5)  The diavola pizzette was topped with crushed tomatoes, peppered salame, roasted red bell pepper, crush red pepper, garlic, mozz, and some evoo. Unfortunately with the amount of toppings, the dough of the pizza soaked it all in and became a mush when I bit into the slice. It was more of a salad with a charred crust. (2/5)  My favorite from the pizzette as was the Vico. Toppings on the Vico included sausage, red onion, mascarpone, basil, mozz, evoo, and roasted fennel. The pizza managed to stay in one piece when picked up unlike the diavola. The texture was awesome with the creaminess of the mascarpone mixed with the succulent sausage and the crunch of the roasted fennel. I would come back for this pizza! (4.5/5)  Lastly, the Emilia pizzette had prosciutto cotto, Italian cream, mozz, evoo, parmigiana reggiona, and corn. This was a very savory and creamy pizza. It lacked acids to balance the flavor and had me taking sips of the Moscow mule to cut the richness. (3/5)   Although I can't say this place is my definite go to for pizza in the neighborhood, their Vico pizza will have me coming back...for happy hour!

Pizza was okay. Luke warm at best. Logan took my order over the phone and messed up my order and also put me down under a completely different name. He didn't bother apologizing and was overall apathetic at best. Logan: you seem lazy and like you don't like your job- maybe you should get a new one and new attitude. Trish the manager should have corrected him on the spot, she was too busy sitting down socializing at a nearby friend. I guess business is good enough here that anything goes in this place.  I don't know if I'll be back here.

Best pizza in Vegas. Great atmosphere too! Also seeing true italians who were there for a long time enjoying their food and their Italian beers has to mean that it must taste like original Italian made pizza. The pizza defenetly tastes like no other pizza I've had before. My girlfriend has been to Italy and she says that it tastes just like it did in Italy. The service was good too. We can't wait to go back again.

Their website claimed they have a special oven and flour and tomatoes from Italy, so I figured this should be an authentic place for pizza. Husband said this is very authentic compared to the ones in Italy. I never went to Italy but this tastes different than all the pizzas I've ever tried. The crust is definately thin and yummy. We ordered the Settebello pizza, insalata grande and tiramisu. The tiramisu is a must try, they claim it's made in-house. Overall, it was a very satisfying meal. And another plus for me since this was another "new" spot I took Husband to during our Vegas trip a few weeks back!

This is a awesome spot for pizza off the strip.  If you're looking for Italian style pizza crust, look no further.  I've went several times with friends that have lived in Italy and they rave about this place.  The pizza is delicious and the staff are amazing.  Lots of parking available.

I'm Italian and I rarely eat Italian food out but this pizza is the best I have ever had.  It reminds me of the pizza I have eaten in Naples Italy.  They maybe char it a bit too much but that is definitely part of the authenticity.  The quality of all their ingredients is top notch.  Very impressive for such a little town.

This is my family's favorite pizza joint, hands down. The service has always been amazing, the atmosphere is comfortable, and the food-delicious. The pizza and the cappuccino are just like everything I've ever had overseas.   Now if they would deliver to my house, I would be in Heaven. And fat.

I have always enjoyed picking up a pizza every so often as I have lived minutes from here for years but it is not until recently that I have come to know and enjoy the fantastic experience of dining in. We had a dinner for my moms birthday with a large party of 12 and it was seamless. They both accommodated and served a cake that we brought in addition to flowers balloons and favors. The food is so fresh light and delicious- you can't imagine such a great light taste to pizza!  The daily drink specials make dining here both fun and dangerous. $4 margaritas on Thursdays! Overall- fantastic fresh food with friendly attentive service. The best pizza place in town.

I lived in Italy for eight years, and the pizza served here is; veramente Napoletana!   This is the closest pizza tasting like Italia in Las Vegas, and I miss living up the street from Settebello (Actually, I liked to be back in Italy.)  Other than the meat...many of the ingredients are imported from Italy, -even the pizzaiolo and one of the servers are from Italy.  I always go here when I visit Vegas.  It's also nice that they moved to the District where they can get more business.

Like no other.  It does not fit my description of usual pizza, but I love it!  The Diavola is so good.  It has perfect spice to it.  Only issue would be that each time we go, it is a little different depending on who makes it-- not necessarily a bad thing, but sometimes we like it better than others due to a thicker crust or more toppings that vary based on the pizza maker.  The decor is great.  The beet salad is awesom and huge!

We stopped by Settebello after work for a relaxing dinner on Sunday evening.  The restaurant was full but we got sat in a booth right away. The waitress was very pleasant and explained how they cook their pizzas.  They are cooked in a 900 degree oven so the crust is crispy and the inside is a little moist.  I order the garden mule, this was very interesting.  It was a spinoff of the Moscow mule with blueberries.  We ordered the warm beet salad and the settebello pizza.  Both were fantastic.  The beets were cooked with goat cheese and pine nuts, the dish came out steaming hot.  The pizza was also delicious.  I will definitely go back.
Love this place! Lunch with clients, or lunch with my husband. Has been excellent every time! Try the Settebello Special, it is the best. Fresh ingredients, great crust, and the flavor is amazing.

Went in for happy hour which is only held in the very small bar area. Bartender was extremely inattentive to us. We had to ask several times on several occasions to get a drink even after putting our empty glasses out towards the bartender to signify we were looking for another drink (which was just a bottle of beer - not like he had to make some foo-foo drink that took 5 minutes to make). Bartender did not explain the way happy hour worked & when we questioned him on it - he gave us attitude. He had originally told us that he had put in our drink order before happy was over but when we asked him to get our order he said that we could pay for another drink if we wanted it instead - it should have been on the happy hour special. Ordered the small pizza with sausage on it - it was so doughy in the middle it was gross & just a floppy mess. He also added my items into another group of people's bill even though I came 45 minutes after them instead of starting my own separate bill. I wouldn't even spend the $5 for happy hour here for food or drink. It's definitely not worth it even if it's not far from my house.

I would like Settebello to consider opening up a restaurant in San Jose, CA. :)  Delicious! Crust was thin, light and chewy! Ordered the Bianca which had white sauce with procuitto, shaves of parmesan and fresh arugula! Scrumptious! Also tried the Settebello which had red sauce, mushrooms and sausage. Very tasty and tomato sauce was light, the sausage was not greasy or heavy.

Had lunch here with some friends on a Friday noon. The place was maybe half full. We ordered the quattro formagio pizza and the settebello with the antipasti appetizer.  The antipasti was very good with 3 kinds of meat, 2 kinds of cheese, artichoke hearts, and garlic flat bread that was very very good.  The pizza here is thin crust, but not crispy... rather doughy. The taste is awesome on both pizzas, but the center part gets soggy which I don't like.  Would come back here with others, but probably not alone as I would not be able to finish one pizza by myself, and would not want to take it home as it will get too soggy.

Outstanding!  My wife and I arrived at around noon and were greeted with smiles and seated immediately. The atmosphere of the place was warm and welcoming, with a nice soundtrack of Italian music playing in the background.  We started our lunch with a Misto antipasto, which was excellent, consisting of two kinds of prosciutto, salami, two kinds of cheeses, olives and pickled zucchini, and accompanied by a delicious focaccia bread.
